name: ChunkingBackend
doc: Token-aware chunking backend using HF tokenizers (default) or tiktoken (feature-gated)

name: new_hf
doc: Create backend with HF tokenizer for specified model

name: new_tiktoken
doc: Create backend with tiktoken for OpenAI compatibility

name: count_tokens
doc: Count tokens in text efficiently

name: chunk_with_overlap
doc: Split text into token-aware chunks with overlap

name: chunk_by_symbols
doc: Symbol-aware chunking strategy - prefer function/class boundaries

name: extract_symbol_text
doc: Extract text for a specific symbol from file content

name: GptChunker
doc: Chunker specialized for GPT models using `tiktoken_rs`.

name: new
doc:
Build from a GPT model id (preferred) or a canonical
encoding name. Non-GPT identifiers are rejected.

name: count_tokens
doc: Count tokens in `text` using the resolved BPE.

name: chunk_with_overlap
doc:
Token-aware chunking with N-token overlap.
Guarantees forward progress and clamps overlaps safely.

name: chunk_by_symbols
doc:
Prefer function/class boundaries; split oversize symbols
with token-based chunking. All symbols must be from the
same source file for coherent metadata.

name: from_symbols
doc:
Build a chunk from a set of symbols by concatenating
their byte-sliced text, preserving order and adding a
single newline between consecutive symbols.

name: extract_symbol_text
doc:
Extract symbol text via byte ranges when possible.
Falls back to line slicing if the range is invalid.

name: run
doc: CLI run function - integrates GptChunker with command-line interface

name: extract_symbols_for_chunking
doc: Extract symbols for chunking (simplified interface)

name: chunk_by_tokens
doc: Token-based chunking fallback

name: write_chunks_and_manifest
doc: Write chunks to files and create JSONL manifest

name: parse
doc:
Parse a target string like
"src/main.rs:1-5,10-15" or "C:\\src\\lib.rs:20-25".

name: run
doc: Public CLI entry point expected by the command layer

name: LanguageSelector
doc: Internal helper that selects target languages

name: resolve
doc: Construct from CLI args and config fallback

name: contains
doc: Test if a language label is selected

name: as_vec
doc: Expose ordered languages for messages

name: FileCollector
doc: File collection based on Gitignore-aware walking

name: collect
doc: Walk the tree and retain files that match selected languages

name: LanguageDetector
doc: Simple extension-based language detector

name: detect
doc: Map file extensions to canonical language labels

name: SymbolsExecutor
doc: Parallel symbol extraction coordinator

name: extract_parallel
doc: Extract symbols from all files using rayon

name: extract_one
doc: Extract symbols for a single file

name: LineNumberMapper
doc: Map byte offsets to line numbers efficiently

name: fill_lines
doc: Compute and assign line numbers for all symbols

name: LineIndex
doc: Immutable index of line start byte offsets

name: new
doc: Build a line index by scanning once

name: byte_span_to_lines
doc: Convert a byte span into 1-based line numbers

name: byte_to_line
doc: Convert a single byte offset to a 1-based line number

name: VisibilityFilter
doc: Filter utilities for visibility post-processing

name: retain_public
doc: Keep only symbols that are public or unspecified

name: JsonlWriter
doc: Stream symbols to a JSON Lines file

name: write
doc: Write one JSON object per line into `output_path`

name: insert_path
doc:
Insert a path into the tree. If `file_lines` is Some(_),
it is applied to the leaf file node.

name: build_tree_with_counts
doc: Build the tree and attach line counts to file leaf nodes.

name: print_tree
doc: Print the tree with formatted labels. Files show `name:lines`.

name: format_node_label
doc: Format node label with colors and, for files, appended `:lines`.

name: count_lines_fast
doc:
Fast, CRLF-safe total line counting.
Counts '\n' bytes and adds one if the file is non-empty and doesn't end with '\n'.

name: extract_lines
doc:
Extract inclusive 1-based line ranges as a single String.
Ranges must be validated and merged by the caller.

name: build
doc: Build an index recording positions of '\n'.

name: line_count
doc:
Total number of logical lines.
Empty buffer => 0 lines; else (#'\n' + 1).

name: start_byte_of_line
doc:
Start byte (inclusive) of a 1-based line.
Returns None if line is out of range.

name: end_byte_of_line
doc:
End byte (exclusive) of a 1-based line.
Returns None if line is out of range.
For CRLF, excludes trailing '\r' before '\n'.

name: byte_range_for_lines
doc:
Byte range (start..end) for an inclusive 1-based line span.
Returns None if the span is invalid or out of range.

name: line_of_byte
doc:
1-based line number covering the given byte offset.
Offsets at '\n' belong to the *next* line.
Returns 0 for empty buffers.

name: NameUtils
doc: Qualified-name helpers

name: join
doc: Join name parts with the given separator into a String

name: Utf8Utils
doc: UTF-8 safe slicing helpers

name: slice_str
doc:
Return a substring by byte range if it is on a char
boundary within `full`, else None

name: slice_node_text
doc:
Convert a tree-sitter byte range to a &str slice,
returns None if boundaries are not valid char
boundaries

name: TsNodeUtils
doc: Common Tree-sitter node helpers

name: has_ancestor
doc: Check if `node` has an ancestor of the given kind

name: find_ancestor
doc: Find the first ancestor of the given kind

name: field_text
doc: Extract text of a child field if present

name: line_range_1based
doc: Convert node positions to 1-based line numbers

name: PyDocUtils
doc: Python docstring helpers

name: docstring_for
doc:
Extract a PEP 257 docstring from a function, class,
or module node. This expects the caller to pass a
node whose first statement may be a string literal.

name: unquote_and_dedent
doc: Remove string prefixes, strip quotes, and dedent

name: dedent
doc: Minimal dedent across all non-empty lines

name: RustDocUtils
doc: Rust doc attribute and comment helpers

name: doc_attr_text
doc:
Extract text from a '#[doc = "..."]' attribute
This supports normal quoted strings. Raw strings
are handled by `doc_attr_text_raw` below.

name: doc_attr_text_raw
doc:
Extract text from a '#[doc = r#" ... "#]' raw string
Supports one or more # markers

name: doc_comment_text
doc:
Extract from '///...' and '/** ... */' when they are
doc comments. Returns normalized text when detected.

name: VisibilityUtils
doc: Simple visibility helpers

name: python_from_name
doc: Python private if name starts with underscore

name: label_from_private
doc:
Generic helper to map a bool private flag to
a string label for quick logs or JSON dumps

name: parse_python
doc: Build a tiny Python tree to test docstring paths

name: FileWalker
doc:
Gitignore-aware walker with optional extra ignore globs.
Extra globs are applied in two places:
1) Early: prune directories during traversal (filter_entry).
2) Late: filter out files that still slipped through.

name: new
doc:
Build a walker with additional ignore patterns (e.g., "target/**",
"node_modules/**", "**/*.min.js"). These are matched on full paths.

name: walk_files
doc:
Traverse files under `root`, respecting .gitignore and extra globs.
Returns a sorted list of file paths for determinism.

name: write_file
doc: Create a file with parent dirs as needed

name: cli
doc: Command-line interface with clap integration

name: completion
doc: Shell completion generation

name: core
doc: Core processing pipeline - High-performance extraction and analysis (2,847 lines total)

name: extract
doc: Line-range extraction with gitignore awareness and memory mapping

name: symbols
doc: Tree-sitter symbol extraction pipeline (Rust+Python locked, 572 lines)

name: tree
doc: Directory tree visualization with depth control and parallel processing

name: chunk
doc: Token-aware content chunking for LLM workflows with tiktoken integration

name: parsers
doc: Language processing - AST parsing and symbol extraction with moka caching

name: rust_parser
doc: Rust symbol extraction with tree-sitter (qualified names, visibility)

name: python_parser
doc: Python symbol extraction with tree-sitter (classes, functions, methods)

name: infra
doc: Infrastructure - Configuration, I/O, and utilities (lean architecture)

name: config
doc: Configuration management with TOML support and feature flags

name: io
doc: Memory-mapped file I/O for large files (>1MB threshold)

name: line_index
doc: CRLF/LF-robust line indexing for O(1) lineâ†’byte mapping

name: walk
doc: Gitignore-aware directory walking with rayon parallelism

name: utils
doc: Utility functions and helpers for common operations

name: PythonExtractor
doc: Extracts Python symbols (functions, classes, methods).

name: new
doc:
Construct a new extractor with a broad query that
captures function_definition and class_definition.

name: extract_symbols
doc:
Parse `content`, run the query, derive symbol data, and
return a flat list of symbols defined in the file.

name: python_qualified_name_method
doc:
Build qualified method names of the form
`Outer::Inner::method`, climbing ancestor classes.

name: python_docstring_extract
doc:
Extract a PEP 257 docstring from a function/class:
first statement in the body must be a string literal.
Supports single/triple quotes, r/u/f prefixes, and
concatenated string sequences.

name: unquote_python_string
doc:
Strip Python string prefixes/quotes and perform a light
unescape plus dedent for triple-quoted strings.

name: leading_alpha_len
doc:
Return the count of leading ASCII alphabetic chars.
Used to slice off string literal prefixes.

name: dedent_and_unescape
doc:
Dedent triple-quoted content and unescape if not raw.
Also strips a single leading/trailing blank line.

name: basic_unescape
doc:
Minimal unescape for common sequences when not raw.
Intended for docstrings, not general Python parsing.

name: has_ancestor
doc: Return true if `node` has an ancestor of the given kind.

name: has
doc: Helper: predicate for kind+name match.

name: get
doc: Helper: fetch a single symbol by kind+name.
